thread.title: Harrison’s Khalid Kareem decommits from Alabama
thread.title_full: Harrison’s Khalid Kareem decommits from Alabama

author: detroitnews.com
title: Harrison’s Khalid Kareem decommits from Alabama
text:
Farmington Hills Harrison defensive end Khalid Kareem (left) announced in June his pledge to Alabama, but he’s now reopening his recruitment. (Photo: Max Ortiz, Detroit News) 
1 CONNECT 3 TWEET LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE Khalid Kareem is no longer bound for Alabama.
Kareem, a four-star defensive end from Farmington Hills Harrison, posted on Twitter on Wednesday morning that he’s decommitted from the Crimson Tide.
“After careful consideration and a lot of heart felt talks with my mother,” Kareem tweeted, “In my (family’s) best interest we’ve informed the Coaches that I am decommitted from the University of Alabama at this time.”
pic.twitter.com/pLPZhiVvA5 
— Khalid A. Kareem (@khalid_kareem93) October 14, 2015 The 6-foot-4 255-pound Kareem is the fifth-ranked defensive end in the Midwest, according to Scout.com, and No. 31 in the country at his position. He is a former Michigan State commit who reopened his recruitment, eventually committing to Alabama in June, picking the Tide over Michigan, Michigan State and Notre Dame.
Scout.com’s Allen Trieu, a Detroit News contributor, confirmed that Kareem will be visiting Notre Dame this weekend.
Have confirmed that Khalid Kareem, who just decommitted from #Bama , will definitely be at #NotreDame this weekend: http://t.co/wxLu4tBk8V 
— Allen Trieu (@AllenTrieu) October 14, 2015
